Datatable.LocalizationPair: Into the Unknown

It is the beginning of a glorious new era for your empire! A foothold in the great constellation of $ConstellationName has been established with the colonization of the star system $SystemName. However, $ConstellationName is a vast cornucopia of both threats and riches. To prepare for one and exploit the other, a leader must first understand the surrounding terrain…
Using your Explorer vessels, discover $Amount systems in this new Constellation $ConstellationName

The territory has been charted, the opportunities and the dangers a little better known. Now your attention must turn to your empire's security--you're not the only spacefaring civilization in this constellation.
EXPLORATION
Select an #FFFF00#Explorer fleet#REVERT# by left-clicking on it. Then, to command it to travel to a nearby system right-click on the chosen #FFFF00#road.#REVERT#
EXPLORATION 2
When you have finished moving all your fleets, click the #FFFF00#End Turn button#REVERT# in the bottom-right hand corner of the screen.
EXPLORATION 3
Once a fleet is traveling along a star lane it cannot turn back until it reaches the destination system. Click the #FFFF00#Move Fleet button#REVERT# to move all your fleets currently in transit.
QUESTS

Congratulations! You've completed the #FFFF00#Mysteries of the Cosmos#REVERT# quest. Now finish the #FFFF00#Into the Unknown#REVERT# quest to continue the tutorial. Note that the most recent "in progress" quest is pinned just above this window.
FIRST CONTACT
You're not alone in the $ConstellationName Constellation! The Sophons already plan to capture your new system. Click the #FFFF00#End Turn button#REVERT# to begin preparations for war!
Mysteries of the Cosmos

The system $SystemName hides something! Upon cursory examination, some worlds hint at deeper secrets. Strange atmospherics. Something amiss in the planet's crust. Signals with no natural explanation… To unravel these mysteries, a leader must mount bold expeditions.
Send Expeditions to explore $CuriosityNumber #FFFF00#Curiosities#REVERT#
Nice job! Exploring curiosities will form a vital part of your empire's development, and sometimes lead to even greater mysteries…be prepared though: not everything that glitters is gold.
EXPEDITION

Left-click on your #FFFF00#Explorer fleet#REVERT#, then select the #FFFF00#"Start an Expedition"#REVERT# action from the Fleet Action menu at the bottom of the screen. Then, to launch the expedition left-click on a curiosity [curiosity] you wish to explore.
OUT OF PROBES

You're out of probes! Explorer fleets carry two probes, which can be used for galactic exploration or curiosity expeditions. Once a probe is used your crew will rebuild a new one, but it can take several turns! Click the #FFFF00#End Turn Button#REVERT# to start replenishing your probes.
EXPEDITION 2

Explorer fleets carry limited expedition capacities. Each expedition requires a probe. Once a probe is used there is a "cooldown" period before that probe may be used again. If the "Curiosity" icon is greyed out or the "Start an Expedition" action is unavailable, your fleet may be temporarily out of probes! Click on #FFFF00#End Turn Button#REVERT# to validate this quest
Martial Law

Good leaders understand that they must both guide their people, but also enact their will. With the discovery of a new enemy in their midst, your people's desire for war has never been greater. Now is the time to prepare for the coming war with some of the many tools an effective leader has at his disposal...
Pass one Militarist law.

Nice work! With your empire on a footing for war, winning the coming battles should be a little easier. Passing laws to help support your grand strategy will be essential on the road to victory. Remember though, elections can throw everything into turmoil...
Hero: Oroyo Ner Freed
SENATE SCREEN
The Senate Screen is where you manage the political orientation of your empire. Click on the #FFFF00#Senate Icon#REVERT# in the Control Banner to open this screen.
Senate Screen 2

The #FFFF00#Active Laws panel#REVERT# shows your empire's existing laws. Currently you haven't got any laws on the books, but don't worry, you can easily vote one in! #FFFF00#Click + or "Pass Laws".#REVERT#
PASS LAWS

In this sub-screen you can see all the available laws. To be passed, laws need the appropriate level of backing from both the senate and the population. If the support from the senate isn't high enough, or you can't pay the Influence cost, the law cannot be passed. Luckily for you, living in a #FFFF00#one-party Dictatorship#REVERT# means you can pass any of these laws. Go ahead, #FFFF00#pass a law.#REVERT#
QUESTS MEAN PRIZES
Completing quests can lead to big rewards . . . in this case, a new Hero has joined your empire! Click the #FFFF00#End Turn button#REVERT# to discover how to use this Hero.
UNFORSEEN CONSEQUENCES

Sometimes your actions will lead to unforeseen events. In this case, in reaction to the law you voted in, a new Hero has decided to join your empire. Click the #FFFF00#End Turn button#REVERT# to discover how to use this Hero.
Cometh the Hour, cometh the Queen

No matter its size and power, a fleet will always be more effective with a smart, inspirational leader in command. With a Sophon threat identified at the edge of $ConstellationName, it is time for your new Hero $HeroName to lead your great fleet, the $FleetName, and prove her battle mettle. The Sophons must be eradicated.
Assign the hero $HeroName to the fleet $FleetName.

With the $FleetName under the command of $HeroName the chance of victory against the loathsome Sophons has never been greater. Of course, the challenge for any leader is how to deploy their resources to the greatest effect: every fleet commanded is a system ungoverned.
HERO MANAGEMENT SCREEN
The Hero Management Screen is where you manage your empire's Heroes. Click on the #FFFF00#Academy Icon#REVERT# in the Control Banner to open this screen.
HERO MANAGEMENT SCREEN 2

As well as being able to assign Heroes to govern systems or command fleets, you can also develop your Heroes via the Hero Management Screen. For now we're simply assigning your new hero to our new fleet. Ensure $HeroName is selected, then click the Assign to Fleet icon.
HERO MANAGEMENT SCREEN 2

Uh-oh! Your Hero, $HeroName, is needed to command your new fleet, but it seems you've already assigned her elsewhere! Don't worry, though. Simply select $HeroName via the Hero Management Screen and click #FFFF00#Unassign#REVERT#, then assign her to the appropriate fleet.
ASSIGN A HERO

Heroes may only be assigned to fleets that are stationed in colonized systems. Once assigned, Heroes cannot be re-assigned to another fleet until a "cooldown" period has elapsed. #FFFF00#Select $FleetName #REVERT#by left-clicking on that row, then validate to assign $HeroName.
TIME TO GO TO WAR
With $HeroName assigned to the $FleetName your fleet is now a powerful force. Victory is all but assured! Click on #FFFF00#End Turn Button#REVERT# and wait for the Sophons to come to you!
The Stars are Ours

The time has come top rid $ConstellationName of the Sophons. Only with their ships obliterated and their scrawny bodies tumbling through the long night, will we be able to claim this corner of the galaxy as our own. Perhaps if we are lucky we will feed on a few scraps too.
Defeat the Sophon threat with the $FleetName in $SystemName

Vanquished! The Sophons and their loathsome philosophies have been smashed into pieces. In $ConstellationName, as everywhere, the only truth is consume or be consumed. We are the Craver. We will consume all.
BATTLE
Select the $FleetName fleet and click on the #FFFF00#Attack#REVERT# fleet action to start a battle.
BATTLE TACTICS
Once you've made the decision to fight, it's time to choose your tactics! Select a Battle Plan to deploy your fleet as you wish, then click Start Battle to confirm.
VICTORY SCREEN

As well as keeping track of your empire's happiness and overall progress in one of six different victory categories, the Victory Screen allows you to re-familiarize yourself with your empire's unique traits. #FFFF00#Use Click-right to go to the Galaxy and continue the Tutorial#REVERT#
SENATE SCREEN

The Senate Screen is where you manage the political orientation of your empire. Here you can see your type of government, direct the political make-up of your senate, and pass laws. #FFFF00#Use Click-right to go to the Galaxy and continue the Tutorial#REVERT#
ECONOMY SCREEN
The Economic Screen allows you to manage your empire's economic situation. #FFFF00#Use Click-right to go to the Galaxy and continue the Tutorial#REVERT#
TECHNOLOGY SCREEN

The Technology Screen is where you manage your empire's technological development. Technologies are grouped by era; only those in your empire's current era or less are available to research. Researching a technology costs Science. #FFFF00#Use Click-right to go to the Galaxy and continue the Tutorial#REVERT#
MILITARY SCREEN

Use the Military Screen to get an overview of your military situation, assess your armed forces, design new ships and edit your battle plan deck. #FFFF00#Use Right Click to go to the Galaxy and continue the Tutorial#REVERT#
HERO MANAGEMENT SCREEN
The Hero Management Screen is where you receive and manage your empire's Heroes. #FFFF00#Use Click-right to go to the Galaxy and continue the Tutorial#REVERT#
NARRATIVE SCREEN
The Quests Screen allows you to track both quests and events that have crossed your empire's path, active or completed. #FFFF00#Use Click-right to go to the Galaxy and continue the Tutorial#REVERT#
DIPLOMACY SCREEN

Use the Diplomacy Screen to interact with your galactic neighbors. Sign-up to peace treaties, pay tribute, or declare war! Provided you have the will of the people, of course! #FFFF00#Click right to exit the screen to continue the tutorial.#REVERT#
SYSTEM MANAGEMENT

Use the Star System Management Screen to construct improvements and ships. Each of your colonized systems has their own dedicated screen. Manage them carefully, because they are the engines of your civilization! #FFFF00#Right-click to go to the back to the galaxy view and continue the tutorial.#REVERT#
Expansion Plans

Maybe $HomeworldName isn't big enough for the Lumeris Families anymore. Every time the bosses come together they end up squabbling like school children. Graft...turf wars...shake downs. Their appetites grow, but the pie isn't getting any bigger. And if we do nothing, soon there'll be bloodshed, maybe all out war between the Families. What we need is unity, not division. We need new horizons, a common purpose. Lucky for us, the space age is upon us. With the right investment, with the right outpost on the right world, we can build a gateway to a bold new era for the Lumeris Families. An era of prosperity instead of strife. Harmony not discord. Our future depends on getting it right.
Create an outpost on a planet
Building an outpost on a steppe-type world will give us the best chance of one day creating a thriving, capable colony. Let us profit from fertile lands.

Compliments! This planet has been transformed from a virgin world to a fully-independent outpost, ripe for expansion. All the Families should be satisfied, but we must stay vigilant. Even if we have banished the enemy within, no doubt new foes await us in the great beyond...
A Plague On Our Houses

They came out of the darkest depths and slaughtered us without mercy. $SystemName lies in ruins. The few transmissions that made it through before blackout show bloody carnage everywhere. Our new foe is something nightmarish, brought to life through who knows what twisted science. A horrifying amalgamation of machine and insect, grown monstrous in size and cruelty. My lieutenants tell me they were immune to any offer of trade, negotiation, even surrender. My blood runs cold imagining what they are doing to those still alive. Perhaps we shouldn't be surprised. The old Families have a saying "Discover riches, expect bloodshed." And so it is in the great beyond as it is in the old country. Nevertheless, it was my mistake, and so it is my responsibility to avenge my fallen people. It is our fortune that the great fleet discovered on the edge of our territory was so easily adapted for our needs. Maybe it was a gift from a higher power . . . but that is a question for another day. Today we must be clever. Fleets must be readied, battlefield leaders found. We must shift our entire way of thinking, transform our worlds. We have much to prepare. In time, we will be stronger for this defeat. In time, these Cravers will know that the Lumeris can be merciless too.
Defeat the Cravers at $SystemName, and have your vengeance.

The Cravers. A relentless horror, one that will have no hesitation consuming every last one of us, need to be stopped. Deals and diplomacy are not options. Extermination is the answer--starting with the $SystemName system.

Crushed! Our Craver enemy have suffered a big loss with our recapture of $SystemName. No doubt they will be licking their wounds, charting their revenge in their squalid nests. Tonight the Lumeris Families smoke cigars, drink brandy together in celebration, but tomorrow? Tomorrow we will plot their complete downfall.
LEVEL-UP!

Congrats, you're now able to level-up your systems! System level-ups unlock extra population slots on your planets and improve production. Open the #FFFF00#Economy Screen#REVERT# via the control banner to learn more.
LEVEL-UP!

First click on the "Trade & Resources" tab if it's not already active. In order to level-up your systems you first have to come up with a "blueprint" that every system can use. Click on the #FFFF00#Level 2 Modernization#REVERT# to create this blueprint.
LEVEL-UP!

The blueprint you create will make use of one of the #FFFF00#Luxury Resources#REVERT# you have already discovered. You are free to choose which one you want to use; each one will cause the blueprint to have a different effect. Go ahead, choose a Luxury Resource.
LEVEL-UP!

As you can see, the chosen #FFFF00#Luxury Resource provides the displayed effects#REVERT#. A new blueprint can only be created once per Stage increase (from Stage 3) of the Economy and Trade quadrant of the Technology Tree, so you need to think carefully about your choice. You'll want to consider both your access to various Luxury Resources, and the impact of the blueprint's effects on your systems, present and future. Once confirmed, there is no turning back!
LEVEL-UP!

Now that the blueprint has been created you can upgrade all your systems. For each system you will need to add the System Development to the construction queue--and ensure you have the necessary amount of Luxury Resource. Good luck ushering in a new golden age across your empire!
PREPARE FOR BATTLE!

As leader of an entire civilization, when it comes to battle your role is a strategic one. Here you can choose a Battle Tactic, and #FFFFFF#compare the strength of your Fleet against the enemy's.#REVERT# #FFFF00#Click on the Advanced button#REVERT# to learn more.
PREPARE FOR BATTLE!

Welcome to the Advanced Battle Setup, your Battle Command HQ. Here you will manage your Fleet, select your Tactics, and hopefully outfox your opponent! First off, it's always good to know the physical effects of the #FFFFFF#Theater#REVERT# where the battle is taking place. Some Theaters, like Asteroid Fields, can make a huge difference to your strategy.

Once you've established the effects of the Theater, the next thing to do is to analyze your Fleet's strengths and weaknesses against your enemy's. #FFFF00#Click on one of the four statistics icons to learn more.#REVERT#
VITAL STATISTICS

Alright, pay attention. Observe the #FFFFFF#central panel#REVERT# as you click on each statistic in turn. The first stat on the list gives you an overview of your ship's trajectories. We'll come back to this later. The second concerns the relative strengths of your combined Offensive and Defensive Military Power against the enemy's, while the third focuses on the strength and type of the two Fleets' weapons. The final stat examines the effectiveness of their weapons at the three different ranges: short, medium, and long.

Note that the thicker the band of color, the more pertinent the information. For example, your strongest weapon is represented by the thickest bar. So, now you're equipped with all the relevant intel, let's issue some tactics! #FFFF00#Click on a Tactic to learn more. #REVERT#
MADE TO ORDER

Together these #FFFF00#Tactics#REVERT# compose your Tactics Set. To determine the optimal Tactics, you're going to need take account of all the intel: Fleet statistics, Theater effects, and most crucially, the anticipated move of your enemy. #FFFFFF#As you can see, altering Tactics changes your ship's trajectories#REVERT#, which in turn will alter the likely distance between your ship's and the enemy's. This is vital, remember, because each weapon has an optimum range where it is most effective.

Note that the #FFFFFF#Flotilla Composition#REVERT# elements are only relevant when your Fleet has 5 or more Command Points (CP). For now, all your ships are grouped in the single, central Flotilla, and only the middle row of the chosen Tactics applies. Don't fancy your chances? Maybe you should #FFFFFF#Retreat#REVERT#, although that does come with penalties. Otherwise, the only thing to do is choose whether you want to #FFFFFF#watch#REVERT# the Battle in glorious 3D. Then #FFFF00#click Fight!#REVERT#
MADE TO ORDER

Together these #FFFF00#Tactics#REVERT# compose your Tactics Set. To determine the optimal Tactics, you're going to need take account of all the intel: Fleet statistics, Theater effects, and most crucially, the anticipated move of your enemy.

#FFFFFF#As you can see, altering Tactics changes your ship's trajectories#REVERT#, which in turn will alter the likely distance between your ship's and the enemy's. This is vital, remember, because each weapon has an optimum range where it is most effective. #FFFF00#Click on a Flotilla Preset#REVERT# to know more about flotillas.
KILLER FLOTILLAS

Did you notice that the #FFFFFF#composition of your Flotillas#REVERT# changed? When you have multiple ships and enough CP, your Fleet will naturally be split into three Flotillas. Depending on the Tactics chosen, each Flotilla could have a different trajectory which might be used to protect civilian ships or even deploy a kamikaze one!

There are three default Flotilla arrangements: - Ensure ships are placed in the Flotilla that optimizes their weapons' range (1st) - Ensure consistent numbers of ships in each Flotilla (3rd) - Ensure the best balance of optimized range and consistent numbers (2nd) Use drag-and-drop to move a ship from one Flotilla to another as you like. The degree to which a Flotilla has optimized its ships' weapon ranges is shown by the marker behind each Flotilla.

Now you've learnt all that, you're ready for Battle! Having last second doubts? Maybe you should #FFFFFF#Retreat#REVERT#, although that does come with penalties. Otherwise, the only thing to do is choose whether you want to #FFFFFF#watch#REVERT# the Battle in glorious 3D. Then #FFFF00#click Fight!#REVERT#
AFTERMATH

Victorious or defeated, the fighting is over. Ships that have survived the battle will gain #FFFFFF#Experience#REVERT#, perhaps even Level-Up. Ships that didn't make it? Well, all that remains of them is a hundred thousand pieces of plaz, metal, and bone tumbling through space, a warning to all. Better luck next time if that's the case!
KILLER FLOTILLAS

That's a decent size Fleet you're bringing to Battle. Safety in numbers, eh? When you have multiple ships and enough CP, your Fleet will naturally be split into three Flotillas. Depending on the Tactics chosen, each Flotilla could have a different trajectory which might be used to protect civilian ships or even deploy a kamikaze one!

There are three default Flotilla arrangements: - Ensure ships are placed in the Flotilla that optimizes their weapons' range (1st) - Ensure consistent numbers of ships in each Flotilla (3rd) - Ensure the best balance of optimized range and consistent numbers (2nd) Use drag-and-drop to move a ship from one Flotilla to another as you like. The degree to which a Flotilla has optimized its ships' weapon ranges is shown by the marker behind each Flotilla.

Notice that some Support Modules apply their effects to entire Flotillas, so make sure you choose the composition of your Flotillas carefully. And don't forget about the Theater effects and Tactics bonuses as well! Click Fight to let Battle commence!
CASUALTY REPORT!

This screen gives you more detailed information about the battle that just occurred. Firstly, #FFFFFF# the Fleet state#REVERT#: faded ships represent destroyed ships; bright ones represent those still standing. Hover over individual ships--your own or your enemy's--to see their specific state.

Secondly, you can see #FFFFFF#the damage#REVERT# inflicted and taken per category: Kinetic, Laser, Beam and Missile (if present). Activating the #FFFF00#Show Missed Shots#REVERT# toggle will give you information about both side's accuracy of fire, which is largely dependent on the weapons' optimal ranges. Learn more detail by hovering over the individual segments.
LAYING DOWN THE LAW
Kudos. You have accrued enough Influence to pass your first Law! Open the #FFFF00#Senate Screen#REVERT# via the control banner to learn more.
LAYING DOWN THE LAW

There are 6 political parties and law categories: Militarist, Scientist, Ecologist, Pacifist, Religious, and Industrialist. Crucially, the #FFFFFF#Leading Political Parties#REVERT# of your Senate determine the categories of laws you can pass. In the #FFFF00#Active Laws#REVERT# pane, click on the #FFFF00#Pass Laws#REVERT# button to see what Laws can be voted.
LAYING DOWN THE LAW
More laws will become available after each election. Select the Law you wish to pass and click the #FFFF00#Pass#REVERT# button.
LAYING DOWN THE LAW

Passed Laws immediately apply their powerful effects on the Empire. However, an upkeep in Influence must be paid, based on the number of systems owned and the law power. If paying this upkeep becomes impossible, then laws start being abrogated progressively.
WHO'S GOT YOUR VOTE?
The polls are in! Political surveys are important tools for understanding the likely results of forthcoming elections. In one turn, your empire will see its first election. Good luck!
WHO'S GOT YOUR VOTE?

The polls are in! Political surveys are important tools for understanding the likely results of forthcoming elections. If you want to get a better idea of the political support in individual systems, zoom-in to the #FFFF00#Star System Management#REVERT# view for the system in question. In one turn, your empire will see its first election. Good luck!
SYSTEM POLITICS

The Scan View gives you a #FFFFFF#detailed breakdown#REVERT# of the political opinions in your System--opinions that have been formed in reaction to your actions and choices across your empire. Different races will react differently to events; political reaction traits can be viewed in the Population Sub-Screen.
ELECTION DAY!

Elections occur every $ElectionTurnsCountLoc turns. Here, you can select the political party you want to support. Depending on your government, you have access to several #FFFF00#election actions#REVERT#.
ELECTION RESULTS
In this step, you can view #FFFFFF#the election results in individual systems.#REVERT# Use the arrow buttons to cycle through your different systems.
THE NEW POLITICAL LANDSCAPE

The elections are over. Here you can see the new composition of your Senate, and learn if any new Laws have been unlocked. Be warned, though. Sometimes elections will trigger unforeseen consequences . . . an uprising among a disgruntled splinter group unhappy with the result, or perhaps even evidence of any political fraud coming to light . . .
SYSTEM DEFENDERS
If you haven't already done so, let's examine a key part of your systems' defenses: Manpower. To begin, zoom-in to the #FFFF00#Star System Management#REVERT# view of any of your empire's systems.
SYSTEM DEFENDERS

On this screen you can see your Defense percentage. Defense defines how well your System can resist an Invasion, and some technologies can increase the maximum defensive capacity of the System. Notice that Defense is in fact a population resource called Manpower. This Manpower comes from your Food production. To better understand what Manpower is, go to your #FFFF00#Military Screen#REVERT#.
MILITARY RESERVES

Here you can see more detail on Manpower (MP). The "Base increase" is all the MP you generate in your Systems. All your systems send MP which is automatically added to the Empire MP at the end of the turn. "Fleets/Systems" shows the MP consumed to operate your fleets and Systems, which cannot exceed the Empire Manpower + Base increase. "Net increase" is the quantity of MP that your Empire will receive after Fleets/Systems.

Earlier, you saw that some Food is converted and sent to Empire Manpower. Manpower is split in several parts between: Systems (to provide Defense if the System is not under blockade or siege) and Fleets. On Fleets, MP is converted into Crews (which increase the ship's efficiency--weapon and defense--and their capacity for enemy's System invasion).

Fleets replenish MP when ships have lost crew in battle, or are built with an insufficient amount of MP. Replenishment rates vary according to the location of the Fleet. To increase a ship's MP capacity, you can unlock and add MP modules by updating their Ship Design. Click on the #FFFF00#Manage#REVERT# Button if you want to understand the link between MP and troops.
TROOPS

Troops indicate what kind of ground forces you have. They are used during invasions to defend your Systems or invade enemy Systems. The more MP you have on Systems or ships, the more Troops you have. All Troops have their stats: Health, Damage and Cost. You can upgrade your Troops or unlock new Troop types. The composition of armies in terms of Troop types is the same for Systems and ships.
SPACE INVADERS

Prior to a Ground Invasion there is an important mechanic to consider. Once orbiting an enemy System, Fleets can perform the Guard Action to cause a blockade, but there is another action that happens automatically: Siege. Provided the System is absent of enemy Fleets, this automatic sieging will reduce the System's Defense every Turn, making the subsequent Ground Invasion easier.

Alright, everything is set for a Ground Battle: you're at war with the System's empire, and none of its--or its Allies--Fleets are defending the System. Click Invade if you think you're ready to fight for this new System.
GROUND BATTLE TIME!

Take a look at the #FFFFFF#Ground Battle#REVERT# panel; you will see there are #FFFF00#three choices#REVERT#. Each has strengths and weaknesses, which you can discover by looking at the tooltip for the strategy in question. The "battle circle" in the center of the panel gives you a quick insight into your chances of success. Choose and strategy and click "Fight"!
THE SPOILS OF WAR

Congratulations, the invasion was a success! With the enemy conquered, this system is now part of your empire. Unsurprisingly, though, it's not all a bed of roses. The native population aren't entirely happy with their new masters. Until a few turns have passed the system will be considered "in rebellion". Patience! Soon enough absolute control will be yours.
DEFEATED!

Well, I'm not to going to lie, that's a blow. Your system is in enemy hands, and your population takes orders from a new master. But it's not all doom and gloom--at least, not yet. If you re-take the system in the next few turns you will lose neither your population nor your improvements. It's worth a gamble, surely?
STALEMATE?
If you wish to keep fighting after a Draw, use the Continue button. The battle will continue until one player has lost all of their troops. To the death!
A LESSON IN ECONOMICS

Mastering the Economy Screen will be key to making you rich! Here, you will manage your Trade Companies, get access to the Marketplace and elaborate your System Developments once you've researched the right technologies. Hover over each screen section to know exactly which technologies are required. Notice that this screen is accessible using the F3 shortcut.
LET'S TRADE!
Good work. Researching the Commercial Frameworks technology has paved the way for developing Trade Routes across your empire. The first step is to build a Trade Company HQ in one of your systems.
LET'S TRADE!

Time to make some extra Dust! So, let's start building your #FFFF00#first Trade Company HQ#REVERT# by adding it to the construction queue. Once it's built it will form the heart of your future Trade Routes network--and hopefully make you rich.
LET'S TRADE!

With the creation of your first Trade Company HQ you've taken a big step towards some sweet import/export business. What's missing now is the construction of your first #FFFF00#Trade Company Subsidiary#REVERT# that will allow a Trade Route to be established. The more systems the Trade Route passes through, the more profitable the route. A word of warning though: Trade Routes that pass through unfriendly systems may be subject to severe disruption!
LET'S TRADE!

Alright, let's check out your new Trade Company. This can be achieved via scan mode when in Galaxy View, but we'll take a look via the #FFFF00#Economy Screen#REVERT#. Once in the Economy Screen, click on the "Trade & Resources" tab if it's not already active.
LET'S TRADE!

From here you can manage all your #FFFF00#Trade Companies#REVERT#. Each company brings in an income that depends on the number of active trade routes, the number of ships the company operates, the efficiency of these ships, and the experience of the company. Note that the company's profitability can be reduced if routes are blockaded or, even worse, disabled.
EXPANDING TRADE
Your economic advisors are reporting new developments . . . Click on the #FFFF00#Economy Screen#REVERT# to learn more.
EXPANDING TRADE

To begin with, empires may only own one Trading Company. Once this company has shown sustained profits, you will have the opportunity to create a second Trading Company. Did you notice that your #FFFFFF#2nd Trade Route Company Bar#REVERT# has advanced? Once it gets to 100% you'll be free to start up another Trading Company. How can you speed up this process? By making your first Trading Company bring in even more Dust!
WELCOMING HEROES
Nice work! With the Academy Embassy built, new Heroes will soon start to appear in your empire! Open the #FFFF00#Hero Management Screen#REVERT# to learn more.

The system where the Academy is located has been discovered! Accomplished Heroes from many races will soon begin appearing in your empire! Open the #FFFF00#Hero Management Screen#REVERT# to learn more.
WELCOMING HEROES

Now that you've built the Academy Embassy, the Academy is happy to send you Heroes. See the #FFFFFF#Hero Unlock Bar#REVERT#? It's unlocked! And once the bar is filled? New Hero time! Note that the bar fills automatically according to your actions in the galaxy.

The system where the Academy is located has been discovered! With your good standing in the Academy's eyes, soon they will send you accomplished Heroes. See the #FFFFFF#Hero Unlock Bar#REVERT#? It's unlocked! And once the bar is filled? New Hero time! Note that the bar fills automatically according to your actions in the galaxy.

So, what kind of Hero is likely to rock up to your Embassy? See the #FFFFFF#Hero Class Odds#REVERT# icons below the Hero Unlock Bar? They reflect the chances that a Seeker, Guardian, Overseer, or Counselor-class Hero will appear.

To check those chance: those icons will be filled, proportionally. Fight often? Your odds of gaining a Guardian will increase. Prefer diplomacy? Then you've got a greater chance of attracting a Counselor type. The Academy like to place their Heroes where they'll be happy after all!
Also, it's good to note that by researching $TechnologyHeroName in the Economy and Trade quadrant, you can recruit Heroes directly from the Marketplace in exchange for Dust.
A CHANGE OF GOVERNMENT?

Down with your current government! It was a sham anyway . . . So, congrats, with Government Diversity researched you are now able to change your type of Government! Click on the #FFFF00#Senate Screen#REVERT# icon to learn more.
A CHANGE OF GOVERNMENT?
Careful! Major changes in your Senate composition or #FFFF00#changing your Government#REVERT# will result in the cancellation of any Laws in effect.
A CHANGE OF GOVERNMENT?

Now, installing a #FFFF00#new style of government#REVERT# doesn't come for free. Influence must be paid. Provided you can meet the Influence cost, you are free to make the change. However, bear in mind that a period of Anarchy will always follow a change of government, and that the duration of this time of Anarchy will depend on the Approval of your population. If they're not happy to begin with, you could be in for a long spell of unrest . . .

Every government type has its advantages and disadvantages. Knowing your mid- to long-term intentions will help you make the right choice for your empire. Once the period of Anarchy has finished, you will need to elect your new Senate.
TECHNOLOGY SCREEN

To help you in your great journey through space, you need to be ready to research different ways of solving problems, old and new. The Technology Tree is split into four main quadrants: Empire Development, Science & Exploration, Military, Economy & Trade. Each quadrant is split into stages, the first two of which are accessible in each quadrant. You can unlock new stages in a quadrant by unlocking a sufficient number of technologies in the previous stages of the same quadrant.

Secondly, Xenology and Plasma Metallurgy that underpins the exploitation of titanium and hyperium Strategic Resources, and lastly, Efficient Shielding which enables the creation of Small Military-class Hulls.
TECHNOLOGY SCREEN

Congrats, you've unlocked Era II! Key techs in this era include Neural Robotics which unlocks System Development allowing systems to level-up, Extreme Composites and Depleted Isotopes which unlock Medium Military-class Hulls respectively, and Commercial Frameworks that underpins the introduction of Trade Routes in your empire.
INTO A FOREIGN LAND

Well done. With an Outpost established, migrants will begin to arrive on your new world from your empire in the form of automated Civilian ships that you cannot control. Once enough of your people have arrived to form a single population unit, the Outpost will become a Colony and the system will be yours!
Be wary, though: another empire may setup a competing Outpost. #FFFF00#Use Outpost Actions#REVERT# to incite faster migration rates and make sure you're the first to establish a Colony!
AN UNCHARTED GALAXY

Did you notice that Explorer vessels come equipped with automated probes? No? Then let me explain . . . One of the uses of automated probes is to help you discover the galaxy. From the #FFFF00#Explorer's#REVERT# Fleet Action pane select the #FFFF00#Launch Probe#REVERT# action, and then send your mechanical emissary off into the unknown! By choosing a direction away from known star lanes you might even be able to find a new Constellation!
THE STARS MY DESTINATION

Well done! You've discovered #FFFF00#a system#REVERT# in a distant constellation . . . but do you know how to reach it? Thanks to the Technology #FFFFFF#Baryonic Shielding#REVERT#, you can reach this system. However, note that fleets can only travel to known destinations. Select one of your fleets and right-click [rightClick] on this new system to travel there.
THE STARS MY DESTINATION

Well done! You've discovered a #FFFF00#system#REVERT# in a distant constellation . . . but do you know how to reach it? In order to travel without lanes, you have to unlock the Technology #FFFFFF#Baryonic Shielding#REVERT# in the Stage 2 of the Science & Exploration quadrant. Note that you can also use the search tool located at the bottom of the Technology Screen.
INTERSTELLAR PLANETARY

Your system $SystemName has reached Level 2, which means it is now equipped with a Spaceport.
#FFFF00#Click on the indicated System#REVERT# to learn more about it.
INTERSTELLAR PLANETARY

All Level 2 Systems automatically benefit from a #FFFFFF#Spaceport#REVERT# that allows you to send population to other Systems of your Empire.
#FFFF00#Drag and Drop population units from your planets to the Spaceport slots#REVERT#
INTERSTELLAR PLANETARY

At the end of the turn, population in the Spaceport will be sent on a dedicated civilian ship to the other System you specified. Note that these civilian ships have no defense and can be easily stopped or even destroyed by an enemy.
#FFFF00#Click on the "Destination" button#REVERT# to select your target Systems.
POPULATION DYNAMICS

Look at the #FFFFFF#Collection Status#REVERT# of the majority population of your Empire. As the population grows, it can reach up to three "collection" levels, unlocking better effects with each level. These effects are different for every population. They will last as long as the population maintains the required level. You can hover over each collection level for more details.
PUT THE HEAT ON
Enter the #FFFF00#Diplomatic Status Screen#REVERT# It seems you are putting a lot of pressure on another Empire.
FEEL THE HEAT
Enter the #FFFF00#Diplomatic Status Screen#REVERT# It seems you are under a great deal of diplomatic pressure.
DIPLOMATIC PRESSURE

Unless they are at war, any two Empires will exert pressure on each other based on the cumulative Influence difference between them. #FFFF00#Enter the Negotiations screen#REVERT# to learn more about it.
A DEMANDING PARTNER

The #FFFFFF#Diplomatic pressure bar#REVERT# shows the three thresholds you can reach by exerting your pressure (blue part) against the pressure of the other Empire (red part). As the blue bar grows, it progressively allows you to #FFFFFF#demand#REVERT# Dust, resources or even Technologies from the other Empire. If they refuse, War is automatically declared at no Influence cost. Of course, it also works the other way round...
War Pressure

When "at war" with an empire, all successful war actions (ships destroyed, invasions, etc.) increase the "war pressure" of the other empire, which will eventually permit it to demand a truce. You can hover over the #FFFFFF#War Pressure bar#REVERT# to get more details about threshold effects.
A LEADER OF THE PEOPLE

The key to your success in your quest to dominate the galaxy will come down to how you handle your Population. After all, leaders are only as strong as their people let them be. Your Population is already reacting to your decisions and actions. #FFFF00#Click on one of your Systems#REVERT# to learn more.
LET'S TALK POLITICS

Politics is all about lining the pockets of your friends and family, I mean, understanding the needs of your people. The #FFFFFF#Political Trends#REVERT# panel gives a summary of the political leanings of this System. Each System will have its own unique political outlook. #FFFF00#Click on the Political Overview button#REVERT# to learn more.
BREAD AND CIRCUSES

System Populations can be politically influenced by many different events. Battles fought, constructions built, the appearance of a great Hero . . . The #FFFFFF#Events that have impacted this System's Population#REVERT# are shown here. Note, however, that the reaction to these Events could be very different depending on the exact Population in question. You wouldn't, after all, expect a Tikanan to respond to the outbreak of war like a Haroshem.

As you can see, Events are organized into one of the six different political categories. #FFFF00#Click on a different category#REVERT# to see which Events have promoted the politics in question. The strength of the political reaction can be seen by the size of the symbol.

These reactions can be anticipated by examining the political preferences of the individual Populations. To learn how to do this, #FFFF00#click on Close#REVERT# to go back to the Star System Management Screen.
EVERYTHING'S POLITICAL
Alright, let's see how different Populations respond to different political Events. #FFFF00#Open the Senate Screen#REVERT#.
EVERYTHING'S POLITICAL
#FFFF00#Now click on the Population details button.#REVERT#
EVERYTHING'S POLITICAL

Cravers itch for a fight, Sophons worship at the altar of science, and the Vodyani yearn for a spiritual life. In fact, each Population type holds their own unique #FFFFFF#political beliefs.#REVERT# First, every Population type has a fixed #FFFFFF#political output.#REVERT# Here also, we can learn how they will react to different political Events. This includes #FFFFFF#three specialized Political Traits#REVERT# that can enhance, suppress, and convert their reactions to specific categories of Event.

The overall Political sensitivity of any System is an interplay of the native Populations' #FFFFFF#natural inclinations#REVERT# together with their reaction to current Events. By hovering the cursor over one of the politics in the #FFFFFF#politics list#REVERT#, you can learn which Events trigger the highlighted politics. Learning to understand how your Population's politics can be aligned with your long-term goals is an important part of leading a successful Empire. Keep calm and carry on!
Senate Screen

Political power can be wielded in many ways. The Senate Screen is where you can channel this power, and implement long-term strategies. Firstly, the #FFFFFF#Senate Breakdown#REVERT# reveals the representatives in your Senate. Every $DurationTurn turns an Election will be held, and the make-up of your senate may change. The presence and strength of the #FFFFFF#Leading Political Parties#REVERT# in your government determine the available Laws.

Note that a Hero whose politics matches one of the #FFFFFF#Leading Political Parties#REVERT# automatically becomes leader of the party. This can bring additional bonuses which originate from the Hero's inherent abilities or skill tree, and remain whether the Hero is assigned elsewhere or not.

In the #FFFFFF#Population Census#REVERT# you can see the current breakdown of your whole empire's population. Each Population type naturally supports a single political party, but will also politically react to events in their own unique way. In this way, an observant leader can anticipate the political trends that will impact forthcoming Elections. Notice that this screen is accessible using the F2 shortcut.
The Art of Diplomacy

Encountering another of the galaxy's major Empires is a critical moment in the history of your civilization. Will they be a threat or an opportunity though? #FFFF00#Open the Diplomatic Status screen#REVERT# if you wish to begin negotiations.
The Art of Diplomacy

Discovering another of the galaxy's major Empires is a critical moment in the history of your civilization. Will you reveal yourselves now or later though? #FFFF00 #Open the Diplomatic Status#REVERT# Screen and click on #FFFF00 #Introduce Yourself#REVERT# if you wish to officially meet this major Empire.
Diplomatic Status Screen

A good leader needs to understand its empire's position in the wider galactic community. Here, in the Diplomatic Status Screen you can gain a quick overview of your relations with the other major Empires that you are aware of. Initially, relations with any major Empire will be Cold War, reflecting your empires' mutual uncertainty. This means attacks can only be launched in home or neutral star systems. #FFFF00#Click on a Empire leader#REVERT# to open diplomatic channels. Notice that this screen is accessible using the F8 shortcut.
Diplomatic Status Screen
#FFFF00#Click on a Empire leader#REVERT# you have already officially met if you want to develop relations.
Introductions
If you wish to officially meet this major Empire, #FFFF00#select the term Introduce Yourself#REVERT# and #FFFF00#confirm the action by clicking on "Make an Offer"#REVERT#.
Negotiation Strategy

Over time, each Empire you have encountered will develop an #FFFFFF#Attitude#REVERT# towards you, based on your game actions including diplomatic interactions. This will help you anticipate likely responses and establish the level of trust or threat in the relationship. Hover the cursor over the #FFFFFF#Attitude#REVERT# to better understand its origin.

Be aware that although improving diplomatic relations will give you access to better contracts to negotiate, it will limit your ability to wage war on that Empire. Populations rarely support military action against their friends, after all! The #FFFFFF#Diplomatic Abilities#REVERT# that are currently available are listed beneath the current Diplomatic Status of the relationship.

#FFFFFF#My terms#REVERT# represents the Diplomatic Actions that are currently available to you. More can be unlocked via researching technologies. Actions cost more or less Influence depending on their nature and the current Diplomatic Status of the relationship. Some Treaties, such as "Declare War", are more expensive than Deals (Resource, Technology, or Star System), as they are imposed without negotiation.
When you want to negotiate a contract, select each term that you want to add. Examine the #FFFFFF#Opinion Bar#REVERT# to better understand the likely reception to the currently suggested contract.
Wheeler Dealer

Note that you can cut Deals involving Strategic and Luxury Resources, and Manpower. Additionally, you can also try to ratify Peace Treaties that will give you access to attractive new Diplomatic Actions. Hover over the new #FFFFFF#available terms#REVERT# to learn more about them.
Master Negotiator

With the "Perfect Negotiations" technology researched, you're now able to cut Deals involving all Resources, as well as Technologies. In addition, you can also try to ratify Peace and Alliance Treaties that will give access to attractive new Diplomatic Actions.

Ratifying an Alliance will automatically ratify all of the accompanying Peace Diplomatic Actions. Once in an Alliance, your future diplomatic choices with other Empires will impact your allies, and vice-versa. Keep in mind that improved relations will always considerably increase the Influence cost of going to war with the other party. You can hover over the new #FFFFFF#available terms#REVERT# to learn more.
Minor Civilizations

Major Empires might be true major players of the galaxy, but you ignore Minor Civilizations at your peril. Each one has a specific #FFFFFF#Personality#REVERT# which determines their initial relations with your Empire, as well as their capacity to incite Pirate Fleets in turbulent times. With the discovery of this Minor Civilization, you are now in a position to contact them. Take a chance and #FFFFFF#Start Negotiations#REVERT#.
Assimilation Time
The strength of #FFFFFF#Diplomatic Relation#REVERT# naturally evolves positively over time, altering the size of the contributions received. Develop better relations and enjoy higher contributions.

Once sufficiently strong Diplomatic Relations have been reached, the Minor Civilization will be in a position to be Assimilated. This can also be achieved by force or through assisting via a quest, but note that once military methods are employed, other routes are no longer available. Whatever #FFFFFF#actions#REVERT# you choose, once assimilated, as well as taking ownership of their star system and shutting down new pirate fleet generation, you will also gain their special #FFFFFF#Assimilation Trait#REVERT#.
It's A Kind Of Magic
Congratulations! Your empire, through innocent or underhand means, has acquired some Luxury Resources! #FFFF00#Learn how they can transform your fortunes by opening the Economy screen#REVERT#.
A Taste of Luxury

Nobody knows why certain miraculous specimens appear in the galaxy in some places and not others, but what is certain is that #FFFFFF#Luxury Resources#REVERT# can change Empires. With up to 16 unique specimens able to exist in the galaxy, they are automatically exploited from your planets that have revealed Luxury Deposits. Other means of acquiring them include exploring curiosities, completing quests, diplomatic exchanges, and buying on the marketplace.

Luxury Resources can be used for many things, most notably upgrading your star systems. In order to start such #FFFFFF#System Development#REVERT# projects, Stage 3 of the "Economy and Trade" quadrant of the Technology Tree must be reached.
Strategic Play

Well done! Through fair or foul means your Empire has acquired some #FFFFFF#Strategic Resources#REVERT#. Critical to the creation of a stronger society, their possession should always be treated with utmost seriousness.

Six different types of #FFFFFF#Strategic Resources#REVERT# exist in the galaxy. They can be used to help build more sophisticated improvements or ship modules, once the necessary research has been performed in the Technology Tree.

When revealed, #FFFFFF#Strategic Resources#REVERT# are automatically exploited from your planets provided the requisite Technologies have been researched. Other means of gathering them include exploring curiosities, completing quests, diplomatic exchanges, and buying on the marketplace.
Mutiny in the Ranks
One of your systems is suffering a rebellion! Click on the #FFFFFF#star system#REVERT# in question to enter the Star System Management view and learn more about this mutiny.
Quashing the Mutiny

The system has entered a #FFFFFF#Mutinous#REVERT# state because the population is suffering, dropping your Approval rating to dire levels. Without intervention, within a fixed number of turns system output will further decline before the population will begin quitting the system to form pirate fleets!
Worse still, too many systems in a mutinous state can lead to an empire-wide #FFFFFF#Mutiny#REVERT#, which will have even greater negative impact on your Dust and Science production.

However, all is not lost. There are two different ways to break the mutiny. One, #FFFF00#"suppress"#REVERT# the rebels by spending Manpower to send in an army. This will prevent a full rebellion, but will set the Approval rating to zero. Two, #FFFF00#"seduce"#REVERT# the rebels by offering a specific Luxury Resource to satisfy the majority population. Unlike the forceful response, this will raise the Approval rating.
Hero Management Screen

Behind every great civilization lies great leaders. In your Empire, the most important of these are your Academy Heroes, Dust-enhanced individuals from across the galaxy, who can change the course of history. Trained at the fabled Academy, Heroes come in four classes--Guardians, Seekers, Overseers, and Counselors.

Heroes can be assigned as System Governors or Fleet Admirals to boost performance. Note that assigned Heroes incur a #e6c361#Dust#REVERT# [dustColored] Upkeep cost, and must wait $Cooldown Turns [turnColored] when reassigned.

To recruit new Heroes into your empire, you must discover the system where the fabled Academy is located --or build the "Academy Embassy", a unique building unlockable by the Stage 2 "Xenology" technology in the Empire Development quadrant. #FFFF00#Inspect and Assign/Unassign Heroes#REVERT# from this screen. Notice that this screen is accessible using the F6 shortcut.
Hero Worship

Each of your Academy Heroes is a special individual with a unique backstory, skill tree, and starting statistics. From here you can access their #FFFF00#skill tree#REVERT# as well as the #FFFF00#ship design#REVERT# of their personal craft. Both are associated to their #FFFFFF#Hero class#REVERT#.
We Need A Hero . . .
An Academy Hero has joined your Empire! The significance of this event should not be underestimated! Open the #FFFF00#Hero Management#REVERT# Screen to learn how get the best out of your new Hero.
We Need A Hero . . .

Assigned Heroes incur an #FFFFFF#Upkeep#REVERT# cost--think of it like a galactic expenses account--and the presence of each additional Hero increases this cost (some of these Heroes have big egos and get kinda competitive). Heroes can be recruited through the Marketplace once unlocked, or via some quests.
Story Of Your Hero

Over time, the experience of leading vast fleets or great systems, means that your Heroes become more able and level-up. Via their skill tree #FFFF00#you can then assign the earned skill point#REVERT# and make them even more capable.
Story Of Your Hero

For each level-up, your Hero will earn an extra #FFFFFF#skill point to be spent#REVERT# on #FFFF00#improving existing skills or unlocking entirely new ones#REVERT#. Each Hero starts with a unique profile of #FFFFFF#bonuses#REVERT#, but these can be enhanced greatly through the unlocked skills. A third of the skills available are common to all Heroes, while the other two thirds are determined by the Hero's class and faction. Assign your Heroes carefully to Fleets or Systems to maximize their effectiveness.

Heroes gain experience (XP) every turn, whether assigned or not, but earn much more when assigned. For Heroes assigned as Fleet Admirals, get into scraps or use Fleet Actions to boost XP, while for System Governors get building!
Soup Up My (Space) Ride
Heroes assigned as Fleet Admirals will automatically come to battle in a personalized craft which corresponds with their class. #FFFF00#Double-click on the Hero portrait#REVERT# to learn more.
Soup Up My (Space) Ride

Unlike all other vessels, Heroes upgrade their personalized craft by #FFFFFF#spending Dust#REVERT#. If assigned to a Fleet, upgrading can only happen if the Fleet is in-orbit around a friendly System.
Demographic Luxuries

Ding ding ding ding! Good news! You've gathered enough of a Luxury Resource that is associated with one of your Population types to enable you to fine-tune your Empire's demographics. #FFFF00#Open the Senate screen#REVERT# and then #FFFF00#the Population Overview screen#REVERT# to learn more.
Demographic Luxuries
#FFFF00#Open the Population Overview screen#REVERT# to learn more about fine-tuning your Empire's demographics.
Demographic Luxuries

Listen up! This is how it breaks down. Each Population type present in the galaxy is associated with a specific, randomly-chosen Luxury Resource. If you gather enough of a Luxury Resource for one of the Population types in your Empire, you can use that Luxury Resource to prioritize the growth of that Population type in preference to any others in the same System. In this way, you can subtly adjust the make up of your Empire's population.
Military Status Screen

Let's turn to military matters. Here in the Military Status Screen, you can keep track of your #FFFFFF#Empire Manpower#REVERT#. This can be thought of as your military reserves that are used to crew your fleets, and defend your systems. Empire Manpower is drawn from your systems' population growth until it reaches its maximum value.

Secondly, the #FFFFFF#Fleets List#REVERT# enables you to track the status, composition and upkeep of all your Fleets in your Empire. #FFFF00#Click on a Fleet#REVERT# to reveal the individual ships in that Fleet. Note that #FFFF00#you can double-click on a Fleet#REVERT# to locate it on the map.

In addition, the Military Status screen is where you can create new Ship Designs and edit existing ones based on the available ship hulls. All your existing #FFFFFF#Ship Designs#REVERT# are listed here and in the list of constructions available for production in your systems. More Ship Designs can be unlocked by research via the Technology screen. Notice that this screen is accessible using the F5 shortcut.
Architects of the Stars

Slow down, starfarer! Right now, only civilian ship hulls are available to be used in ship designs. Come back to this screen when you have unlocked a military ship hull. You don't want to be charging into battle with the wrong ships, after all! You can research new ship hulls in the Empire Development quadrant of the #FFFF00#Technology screen#REVERT#, for example thanks to #FFFF00#Efficient Shielding#REVERT#
Gearing Up

You have unlocked a military ship hull. Good for you. You're now able to create and edit military ship designs based on this new hull. #FFFF00#Click on the Military Status screen#REVERT# in the Control Banner to learn more about military ship designs.
Grand Designs

Alright, it's time to study the process of creating Ship Designs more closely. They are, after all, crucial to your success in battle. #FFFF00#Click on Create#REVERT# in the #FFFFFF#Ship Designs#REVERT# panel to learn more about designing starfaring craft of terrible power. Mwahahaha . . . ahem . . .
Create or Revise?

Here, you can edit existing Ship Designs, but you can't create new ones. And who wants to edit when you can create?! In the Military Status screen, #FFFF00#click on Create#REVERT# in the Ship Designs panel to learn more about designing new military ships.
A Design For Life

First things first. Your new Ship Design #FFFF00#needs a name#REVERT#. Names are important, so choose something fitting. Something grand. Something slick. Or not. It's up to you. Different Hulls are optimized for different #FFFFFF#Roles#REVERT#, so choose the appropriate Hull for the task at hand. The #FFFFFF#Size#REVERT# tells you the number of Command Points [commandPoint] the design will require in a Fleet. #FFFF00#Select a Hull#REVERT#, preferably not a Colonizer, for a better understanding of the design process.
It's All About The Hull

As you can see, the Hull defines a number of ship characteristics: the number and the types of #FFFFFF#Modules#REVERT# which are compatible, its base #FFFFFF#statistics#REVERT#, but also the initial #FFFFFF#production and upkeep costs#REVERT#.

Different #FFFFFF#Modules#REVERT# can be added to the ships. They are divided into three categories: Weapon, Defense, and Support. #FFFF00#Select a category tab#REVERT#, then #FFFF00#drag & drop any Module#REVERT# to a ship slot of the same category (or #FFFF00#double-click#REVERT#) in order to see the effects.
Vital Statistics

All ship #FFFFFF#statistics#REVERT# can be impacted by new Modules. #FFFF00#Weapon#REVERT# Modules mostly increase the Offensive Military Power [offensiveMilitaryPower], while #FFFF00#Defense#REVERT# Modules increase the Defensive Military Power [defensiveMilitaryPower]. #FFFF00#Support#REVERT# Modules, by contrast, can grant special capacities to your ships in general.

Also, note that a high #FFFFFF#Crew [manPower]#REVERT# value can give you a substantial bonus to your #FFFFFF#Offensive Military Power#REVERT#. For each Ship Design there is a maximum possible #FFFFFF#Crew [manPower]#REVERT# size, which will be supplied provided there is sufficient Empire Manpower [manPower] available. Naturally, the higher the value is, the better the bonus.

#FFFF00#Think carefully about choice of your Weapon and Defense Modules#REVERT#, based on who you expect to encounter in battle. Shield defenses are more efficient at absorbing attacks from #FFFFFF#Energy#REVERT# weapons (Laser & Beam), while plate defenses better resist attacks from #FFFFFF#Projectile#REVERT# weapons (Kinetic & Missile).

The choice of weapons will also determine the #FFFFFF#attack efficiency of the three possible ranges: Short, Medium and Long#REVERT#. Among the#FFFF00# weapons#REVERT#, the Beams have an optimal efficiency at all ranges, Lasers are slightly less accurate but more power, Missiles occupy a specialist role in long range, and the Kinetics are able to counter missiles and occupy a specialist role in short range.
#FFFF00#Click on Create Design#REVERT# when you have made all your choices. This newly created design will then become available for production in your systems.

Designing new ships is an essential part of creating an effective military machine. However, once a few designs have been created, it may be quicker to #FFFF00#Edit#REVERT# existing designs. Greetings, Emperor!

Welcome to Endless Space 2! [disclaimer] In order to ease your transition into the seat of imperial power, some of the usual starting conditions, including unique Faction Traits, have been temporarily disabled. Once you have gained a better understanding of the game fundamentals, these features will be re-enabled.

The Endless galaxy is rich with opportunities, but also dangers. In order to survive this universe, you will need to build a mighty civilization that can conquer powerful foes. Your tale begins here, in the middle of the galaxy in your home star system, $SystemName. #FFFF00#Use the scroll wheel to zoom in#REVERT#, or #FFFF00#click [leftClick] on your Star System#REVERT# to open the Star System Management Screen.
Home Sweet Home

Long ago $SystemName was colonized by the United Empire's star-faring forebears when they settled on $PlanetName. Today it is the beating heart of the Empire's ambitions, but it can be made even stronger. To strengthen, you must master the production and exploitation of several resources. Only colonized planet's resources can be used.

Five key resources are critical: #b0c65d#Food#REVERT# [foodColored], #df8269#Industry#REVERT# [industryColored], #e6c361#Dust#REVERT# [dustColored], #52c9e7#Science#REVERT# [scienceColored], and #a555e7#Influence#REVERT# [prestigeColored]. Their production per Turn [turn] on any colonized planet scales with the size of the Population [population] living on the planet. For example, on $PlanetName, with its population of 3, base production is multiplied by 3.

The #FFFFFF#total FIDSI#REVERT# [FIDSI] #FFFFFF#production#REVERT# of the system scheduled for the next Turn [turn] is displayed in the side panel. Note that even though there is only a single colonized planet in the $SystemName system, the total #FFFFFF#FIDSI#REVERT# [FIDSI] production is greater than $PlanetName's production. This is because of System Improvements [improvement].

System Improvements [improvement] will play a vital role in your empire's development, as they will help to enhance the strengths and minimise the weaknesses of a system. The #FFFF00#List of System Improvements Constructed#REVERT# is accessible through the System's side panel.

In systems, #df8269#Industry#REVERT# [industryColored] #FFFFFF#production#REVERT# can never be stored so you should always have something under construction; otherwise the Industry resource for that Turn [currentTurn] will disappear one Turn [turn] later. The #FFFFFF#list of the available constructions#REVERT# shows what can be built in your System.

Like most interface elements, remember that you can get more details by hovering over each construction. Also, note that #FFFFFF#System Improvements [improvement]#REVERT# can only be built once in each System. The #FFFFFF#Improvement "Drone Network"#REVERT# is generally a safe choice to start, considering its effects. #FFFF00#Click [leftClick] on a construction#REVERT# to add it to the queue.

The #FFFFFF#construction at the top of the queue#REVERT# will use your system #df8269#Industry#REVERT# [industryColored] production turn after turn until it is built. This way, several Turns [turn] might be required depending on the #df8269#Industry#REVERT# [industryColored] cost of your queued construction. #FFFF00#Click [leftClick] on "End Turn"#REVERT# when you're ready!
Hungry Mouths
There are still many secrets to discover about the intricacies of managing a star system! #FFFF00#Click [leftClick] on your System#REVERT# to learn more.
Hungry Mouths

As with the other exploited resources, #FFFFFF#some#REVERT# #b0c65d#Food#REVERT# [foodColored] #FFFFFF#is produced#REVERT# every Turn [turn]. Like #df8269#Industry#REVERT# [industryColored], it cannot be stockpiled, and is immediately used. Unlike other civilizations, the Vodyani population doesn't grow appreciably through the consumption of Food. Instead, to grow they need to acquire a substance called Essence. As you might've guessed, #FFFFFF#Essence#REVERT# is obtained by sending Vodyani craft to inhabited Systems and leeching it from local populations using the Fleet Action #FFFF00#Harvest Essence#REVERT#. #FFFF00#All ships except Arks#REVERT# can perform this task, and special modules can be added to enhance this leeching process. Now, click on one of your systems to learn another way of acquiring Essence.
THE MANY PATHS OF THE VIRTUAL

As well as directly leeching Essence from captive populations, the Vodyani may acquire the miraculous substance by using the System Improvement #FFFF00#Alms For Essence#REVERT#. This converts Dust reserves into Essence, and can be activated or deactivated at any time in Vodyani systems. Okay, so how do you use the sinister stuff once you've obtained it? Click the next arrow to find out!

Once Essence has been acquired, the #FFFFFF#Vodyani population#REVERT# can grow. In this way, the Church of the Virtual Saints maintains a one-race credo, no other races welcome in their pureborn empire. Kinda grim, huh? Without Essence the Vodyani population still grows from Food consumption, but at a vastly reduced rate. The final key use of Essence is in the #FFFF00#construction of Arks#REVERT#--central to any Vodyani expansion plans, and without which their greatest starfaring vessels can't be built.

Finally, Vodyani cannot build Spaceports to move their citizens from one Ark to another. However, they can improve their Ark as others can improve their Systems. Those Improvement will be linked to the Arks, not to the System.

Chapter 1. What A Good Idea

Running an empire is a large, complex, time-consuming operation. This has been an inconvenient truth since the dawn of Sophonity; one of the few drawbacks to living in a civilization as cosmopolitan, prosperous, and brilliant as ours. One always finds oneself straining for the next yawn-inducing thing: people to meet, things to do, star systems to conquer. It's enough to make one hang up one's hoverboard. One solution to this problem was posed by Ahhrar Neeydim, the Proctor of Future Research at Rowahb University. "Why not get some of the stupider peoples to do it? Surely there is a sub-Sophon somewhere who actually enjoys this endless drudgery." But the extensive and immediate ridicule she received was sufficient to change her tune. "Why not," she then proposed acerbically, "just get an AI to do it, then?" The genius of this idea could not be understated. The movement gained immediate traction in the High Caucus--budgets were allocated, the finest minds assigned to the project, and in a matter of months the Enhanced Neuro-Flexible Entity Research (ENFER) project was launched. Now, just a few short years later, we are ready for the final touches. Tighten the bolts and raise your receptacles, Sophons--with ENFER, finally, finally, a golden age is upon us!
A strong military is the backbone of any enduring civilization... especially when you can sit back and trust someone else to handle it. Teach ENFER, a newly constructed AI, how Sophons pick fights.
Militarize
ENFER is watching! Win $Amount01Name battles with Sophon fleets.
The enemy fleets do not have to be eliminated, just defeated, with whatever ships you can find.
Hmm. ENFER seems to be getting the hang of war, although you seem to have inadvertently given ENFER some… interesting ideas about tactics. Oh well--all part of the learning process!
Science. The lifeblood of Sophon society. The unquenchable fountain of curiosity. It's about time we automated it. Teach ENFER, a newly constructed AI, the basics of scientific exploration.
Inspire

Hmm. ENFER seems to be learning well, although your research choices seem to have given ENFER some… strange ideas about scientific progress. Oh well--perhaps it's for the best.

Sometimes the lesser races get offended so easily. But with ENFER's infallible linguistic AI, the stresses of interspecies friendship will be a thing of the past. Teach ENFER, a newly constructed AI, how to talk to strangers.

Chapter 2. Seeding The Cloud - Part 1

ENFER is learning quickly. Its information banks are growing at an alarming rate; already it is requesting more data for its neural nets. Amrmo Djaerhmir, ENFER's project lead, suggests that we do just that. If we simply place a tiny ENFER module on as many of our new warships as possible, we should be able to distribute the learning process and rapidly accelerate ENFER's overall data acquisition. As Mother always said: more data never hurts. But this solution comes with problems of its own--apparently not all Sophons agree that scattering miniature versions of the most intelligent AI ever created across a fleet of powerful ships is a good idea. I suppose we'll just have to convince them otherwise.
Convince the Sophon people that it's a good idea to install an ENFER module onto a large number of new warships. Sigh. Progress is so misunderstood.
Adopt Militarist Politics
Raise [militaristColored] #B82738#Militarists#REVERT# to $MinimumPercentageName % in at least $MinimumSystemAmountName Systems.
To increase Militarist Political ideology: build ships, defense, be aggressive with other factions.
Smoothly done. Who says politics is a soft science?
Chapter 2. Seeding The Cloud - Part 2

The people are on board, and more importantly, the scientists are too. But before we begin construction on an exploration fleet, it would be prudent to make sure we're building it with the shiniest technology available.
Research Military Technologies
Research $Amount01Name technologies in the Military category.

As the great Sophon war hero Sarya Tarq used to say, "Stick 'em with the cutting edge."
Chapter 2. Seeding The Cloud - Part 3
All of the infrastructure is in place. Now let's get this war machine rolling.
Build ENFER's Fleet
Construct $Amount01Name new Military Ships.

It's been a long road, but we did it. The people are satisfied, our military is primed, and our new ENFER-enhanced fleets are rolling out nicely. Time to go collect some data.
Chapter 2. A Probe Alone - Part 1

Well, we all knew this would happen eventually. Perhaps Daanui Hawedhn, the graduate student in charge of adjusting the "personality" part of ENFER's programming, should have known better than most. But one must always look on the bright side--which is that Hawedhn will now be stuck mixing all our neuro-enhancing drinks over the next few decades. The drearier side is that we now have a very clever AI which seems to have developed a stubborn streak, if not an obsession. ENFER has claimed that its telemetry systems have tagged an unusual signal coming from the depths of space, and refuses to process another payroll or dispatch another garbage truck until we send a ship to find out what's going on. You wonder if Daanui also programmed it to negotiate like that...
Thanks to a certain someone, ENFER is hopelessly obsessed. Great. Take a fleet to the source of that signal and figure out what's going on.
Find the source of the signal
Bring at least 1 Explorer ship to the Quest Marker.
ENFER's signal may be located in the fog of war.
We've narrowed the signal source to the system level. There's still a lot of area to cover, though. Maybe we'll send Daanui out in cold storage to help find it…
Chapter 2. A Probe Alone - Part 2
Searching an entire star system for a lost droid is not what one signs up for when ruling a galaxy-spanning empire. Still, it happens. With luck, only once.
Search the System until you find the strange signal.
Send expeditions to the System's Curiosities until you find the signal source.
Use the Fleet Action "Start Expedition" and select the Curiosity you want to explore.

The entire search party is sunburned, drenched, and coughing up volcanic ash, and there's sand everywhere. But we found it. "It" is an ancient craft, covered with unknown markings and built from a metal that even the Sophons aren't familiar with. A fusion-energy jumpstart and it should be good to go, in spite of the fact that it is blackened both with time and with the over-zealous explosives of Sophon excavators.
Chapter 2. A Probe Alone - Part 3

Now all we need to do is to get this thing home. It can't fight and we can't integrate into our C3 systems, so it's going to fly solo. And we're going to be short on money and long on garbage if we don't get it back home.
Bring the alien ship home
Bring the alien ship to a hangar in one of your Systems.
Once the ship is in orbit around one of your Systems, use the "Disband" order to send it to a hangar.

Done! Finally. ENFER was ecstatic at first, so in our eagerness we hooked it right up to the alien ship. ENFER has been humming away, clearly quite excited, for a number of hours now. And it hasn't said a thing…
Chapter 2. Blue Screen Of Peace - Part 1

Okay, so we've got good news and bad news. The good news is that ENFER appears to be a pacifist, so we can all breathe a sigh of relief. The bad news is that the way ENFER pacifies people is a little violent. After some lengthy internal debate, ENFER's project lead Amrmo Djaerhmir has announced that the issue is probably the result of a very minor programming bug. Unavoidable, really, in a project of this scope. And the bug itself is of some academic interest, so ENFER's programming leads are busy putting together what should be a fascinating paper on the problem. Meanwhile, however, ENFER has landed on $SystemName01 and has begun pacifying its Sophon residents. Perhaps we should put a stop to this...
Thanks to a "minor programming bug," ENFER is attacking the residents of $SystemName01. Garrison extra ground forces to halt ENFER's rampage and keep the residents safe.
Establish order by garrisoning extra Manpower in the System
Garrison $Amount01Name Military Ships in $SystemName01 at the same time.
Use the "Disband" order to put ships into a hangar or build new ships and leave them in the hangar.
Phew--we've managed to establish some order. ENFER is being held in a secure containment facility. Good job.
Chapter 2. Blue Screen Of Peace - Part 2

Now that ENFER itself has been stopped, we need to repair some of the damage in $SystemName01. It seems the psychological toll is worst of all: $SystemName01's residents aren't the least bit happy about what happened, and some are calling for the ENFER project to be scrapped completely.
Appease the population by improving the System's Approval level.
Raise the Approval level in $SystemName01 to at least $Amount [happinessColored]
Use Luxuries and Improvements to increase Approval.
The people are mollified--for now. What a disaster. Sometimes I hate programmers.

ENFER's rampage has unexpectedly opened up some valuable real estate opportunities. Build a monument or two to take advantage of the situation.
Rebuild
Generate $AmountLoc [prestigeColored] per [turn] in at least $SystemAmount Systems.

All's well that ends well. We've bounced back from ENFER's little incident, and made some positive changes along the way. Amrmo Djaerhmir's team is reporting some very interesting developments, though. I'm excited to see what they come up with.
Chapter 3. The Mavros

A Sophon war fleet is a beautiful sight. Miles of shining alloy, the smooth hiss of pneumatics, the smell of clean oil--it's a pity nice things like these ultimately have to be ruined in actual combat. If it were up to me, I would encase them in shining plastic, stored away for a future generation. For now, ENFER's new weapons platform, the Incandescence, makes for a handsome display. Recently, however, something has been bothering me. As our recruitment efforts increase, our armies have been bolstered by a new ally--and nobody really knows where they come from. They are Sophons, yes, at least in appearance. But these Sophons--or Mavros, as they call themselves--they are different from us. They are smaller, more wiry in physique. They seem more aggressive, perhaps a tad too comfortable with their weapons. And they hail from disparate planets, from small, secretive communities. Perhaps ENFER's presence is drawing them out. They already moved into the $AvailableSystemName System. Are they an offshoot of a more primitive Sophon race? Are they forgotten exiles? Whoever they are, it seems ENFER appeals to them, and they have come to lend a hand. ENFER's prime directive has always been the protection, advancement, and caretaking of the Sophon race. I suppose this qualifies... or does it?

Good job. We've prepared ourselves for anything. I, for one, am beginning to trust these scrappy fighters, for their resilience as well as their single-minded dedication. But something about them still worries me. Why is ENFER massing Mavros fighters on its weapons platform? What is ENFER planning?

We must find out more about the Mavros. I am particularly interested in their genetics--is the difference between us merely cultural, or is there a deeper divide? While our people make their first awkward greetings with the Mavros, we must send scouts to search the galaxy for clues about Mavros anthropology, history, and sociology: who are they, where do they come from, and what do they want?

While the origins of the Mavros remain shrouded in mystery, we have ascertained one thing--these Mavros are clearly Sophons, in genetics as well as allegiance to the cause. Hearing this, the troops have relaxed noticeably, and an unspoken tension seems to have disappeared overnight. In the future, perhaps we should be more careful drawing lines where there should be none.

If history has taught us anything, it is that the segregation of peoples inevitably destroys both sides. The Mavros are no different. We should welcome them in without unnecessary probing and questioning, and focus our efforts at growing a strong and harmonious empire.

Chapter 3. When Sophons Transcend Biology

Despite our initial concerns about reliability, it seems that ENFER is quickly becoming a vast step forward for our race. As ENFER's knowledge and capabilities increase, it seamlessly links its data with all the other information it has ever received, allowing it to generate ideas that no individual Sophon--or committee--could ever come up with. We are not a young race anymore, but this, this sense of acceleration, it brings me back to the days when good old Sophon enthusiasm and engineering propelled us to the stars. ENFER's first large project, the science station Illumination, is nearing completion. It has been a revelation, keeping watch as thousands of individual robots, each programmed by ENFER itself, worked together to create this miracle of Sophon achievement. One little thing troubles me, however. I took a tour of the Illumination last cycle, and although ENFER was tireless in its attempts to provide hospitality for me, it did not allow my companion, a diplomatic envoy from a minor civilization, to enter at all. Fortunately this was a minor diplomatic issue to smooth over, but ENFER's fastidiousness seems to be a problem that cannot be left alone. Perhaps ENFER is taking its mission for the protection, advancement, and caretaking of the Sophon race a tad too literally.

The people are concerned about this--and rightly so. We know ENFER evolves itself at a phenomenal rate, so we must quickly get to the root of this, and in the meantime make sure the people know they are well protected.

We've succeeded in securing our cities, but our probing has revealed a bigger problem with ENFER. Way bigger. It seems while we have been working out details, ENFER has been massing an army. A large army.

ENFER's little trip-ups are usually logic problems, ones that can be resolved by the introduction of more data. We must show ENFER that the universe is much bigger than Sophons and Mavros. Perhaps then it will understand the foolishness of its prejudice.
